metadata.description: Comprehensive validation dataset for job-resume matching system with 20 realistic test cases
metadata.purpose: Validate matching score accuracy and explanation quality across diverse scenarios

testCases.name: Perfect Senior Backend Engineer Match
testCases.jobDescription:
Senior Backend Engineer - Python/Django

We're looking for an experienced backend engineer to join our fast-growing fintech platform. You'll be responsible for designing and implementing scalable microservices, optimizing database performance, and mentoring junior developers.

Required Skills:
- 5+ years of professional software development experience
- Expert-level Python and Django framework
- Strong experience with PostgreSQL and database optimization
- RESTful API design and implementation
- AWS services (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda)
- Docker containerization
- Git version control

Preferred Skills:
- Redis caching
- Celery task queues
- Kubernetes orchestration
- CI/CD pipelines
- Experience in fintech or financial services

Responsibilities:
- Design and develop backend services for our payment processing platform
- Write clean, maintainable, and well-tested code
- Collaborate with frontend team on API contracts
- Optimize database queries and application performance
- Participate in code reviews and mentor junior developers
- Work in an agile environment with 2-week sprints

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
- 5+ years of backend development experience
- Strong problem-solving and communication skills
- Experience working in agile teams

Location: Remote (US only)
Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the United States
testCases.resumeContent:
Sarah Chen
Senior Backend Engineer
sarah.chen@email.com | Seattle, WA | US Citizen

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Senior Backend Engineer with 7+ years of experience building scalable web services and APIs. Deep expertise in Python/Django ecosystem, microservices architecture, and cloud infrastructure. Proven track record of optimizing high-traffic systems and mentoring development teams.

TECHNICAL SKILLS
Languages: Python, SQL, JavaScript, Go
Frameworks: Django, Django REST Framework, Flask, FastAPI
Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Redis, MongoDB
Cloud & DevOps: AWS (EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, CloudWatch), Docker, Git, Jenkins
Tools & Practices: RESTful APIs, Microservices, TDD, Agile/Scrum, Code Review

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Senior Backend Engineer | PaymentTech Inc. | Seattle, WA | 2020 - Present
- Architected and implemented microservices-based payment processing system handling $50M+ monthly transactions
- Designed RESTful APIs consumed by web and mobile applications serving 500K+ active users
- Optimized PostgreSQL database queries, reducing average API response time from 800ms to 120ms
- Implemented Redis caching layer, improving system throughput by 300%
- Built asynchronous task processing with Celery for background jobs and notifications
- Deployed services to AWS using Docker containers on EC2, with S3 for file storage
- Established CI/CD pipeline using Jenkins, reducing deployment time from 2 hours to 15 minutes
- Mentored 3 junior developers, conducting code reviews and pair programming sessions
- Technologies: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Redis, Celery, AWS, Docker, Jenkins

Backend Engineer | FinanceApp Solutions | San Francisco, CA | 2018 - 2020
- Developed backend services for personal finance management platform
- Created Django REST Framework APIs for mobile and web clients
- Integrated third-party financial data providers using RESTful APIs
- Implemented user authentication and authorization with OAuth 2.0
- Wrote comprehensive unit and integration tests achieving 85% code coverage
- Collaborated with frontend team in agile sprints using Jira and Confluence
- Technologies: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS RDS, Git

Software Engineer | TechStartup Co. | San Francisco, CA | 2017 - 2018
- Built web applications using Django and PostgreSQL
- Developed RESTful APIs for internal tools and customer-facing features
- Participated in agile development process with daily standups and sprint planning
- Technologies: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, JavaScript, Git

EDUCATION
Bachelor of Science in Computer Science
University of Washington | 2013 - 2017
GPA: 3.7/4.0

CERTIFICATIONS
- AWS Certified Developer - Associate (2021)
- Python Institute PCAP Certification (2019)

groundTruth.reasoning: Perfect alignment on all dimensions: 7 years experience exceeds 5+ requirement, expert Python/Django skills, strong AWS/Docker experience, fintech background, meets education and work auth requirements
expectedStrengths: Exceeds experience requirements (7 years vs 5 required)
Excellent technical skills coverage with Python, Django, PostgreSQL, AWS, Docker, Redis
Strong domain expertise in fintech/payment processing
expectedConcerns: Minor: No Kubernetes experience mentioned (preferred skill only)
groundTruth.testFocus: Validates excellent match detection with all requirements met and some exceeded

testCases.name: Strong Frontend React Developer Match
testCases.jobDescription:
Frontend Engineer - React & TypeScript

Join our product team to build beautiful, performant user interfaces for our SaaS platform serving enterprise clients.

Required Skills:
- 4+ years of frontend development experience
- Expert knowledge of React.js and modern JavaScript (ES6+)
- TypeScript proficiency
- HTML5, CSS3, responsive design
- State management (Redux, Context API, or similar)
- RESTful API integration
- Git version control

Preferred Skills:
- Next.js framework
- GraphQL and Apollo Client
- CSS-in-JS libraries (styled-components, Emotion)
- Jest and React Testing Library
- Webpack/Vite build tools
- Figma for design collaboration

Responsibilities:
- Build responsive, accessible web applications
- Implement pixel-perfect designs from Figma mockups
- Optimize application performance and bundle sizes
- Write maintainable, well-tested component code
- Collaborate with designers and backend engineers
- Participate in code reviews and technical planning

Qualifications:
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
- 4+ years of professional frontend development
- Portfolio of production web applications
- Strong communication and teamwork skills

Location: New York, NY or Remote
Work Authorization: Required
testCases.resumeContent:

Frontend Developer | MediaTech Solutions | Brooklyn, NY | 2019 - 2021

New York University | 2015 - 2019

groundTruth.reasoning: Strong match with 5 years experience exceeding 4+ requirement, expert React/TypeScript/Next.js skills, GraphQL experience, testing expertise, and excellent portfolio
expectedStrengths: Exceeds experience requirements (5 years vs 4 required)
Excellent frontend skills with React, TypeScript, Next.js, GraphQL
Strong testing culture with Jest and React Testing Library
groundTruth.testFocus: Validates detection of excellent match with preferred skills mastered

testCases.name: Perfect Full Stack Match with Broad Skills
testCases.jobDescription:
Full Stack Engineer - Node.js & React

We're building the next generation of collaboration tools and need a talented full stack engineer who can work across our entire technology stack.

Required Skills:
- 3+ years of full stack development experience
- Strong JavaScript/TypeScript skills
- Backend: Node.js, Express.js, RESTful APIs
- Frontend: React, modern CSS
- Databases: PostgreSQL or MySQL
- Git and agile development practices

Preferred Skills:
- MongoDB or other NoSQL databases
- GraphQL
- Docker and containerization
- AWS or cloud platform experience
- Testing frameworks (Jest, Mocha, etc.)

Responsibilities:
- Design and implement full stack features from database to UI
- Build scalable RESTful APIs and microservices
- Create responsive frontend interfaces
- Write automated tests and participate in code reviews
- Deploy and monitor applications in production

Qualifications:
- 3+ years of professional software development
- Strong computer science fundamentals
- Excellent problem-solving skills
- Team player with good communication

Location: San Francisco, CA (Hybrid)
Salary: $120K - $160K
testCases.resumeContent:

Full Stack Software Engineer

testCases.name: Senior DevOps Engineer with Strong Kubernetes Experience
testCases.jobDescription:
Senior DevOps Engineer - Kubernetes & AWS

We need an experienced DevOps engineer to lead our infrastructure modernization and manage our Kubernetes-based platform.

Required Skills:
- 5+ years of DevOps/Infrastructure experience
- Expert Kubernetes administration and troubleshooting
- AWS cloud services (EKS, EC2, S3, RDS, VPC, IAM)
- Infrastructure as Code (Terraform or CloudFormation)
- CI/CD pipeline design and implementation
- Docker containerization
- Linux system administration
- Scripting (Python, Bash, or similar)

Preferred Skills:
- Helm charts and Kubernetes operators
- Monitoring and observability (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK)
- Service mesh (Istio, Linkerd)
- GitOps practices (ArgoCD, Flux)
- Security and compliance in cloud environments

Responsibilities:
- Manage and optimize Kubernetes clusters in production
- Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines for microservices
- Implement infrastructure as code using Terraform
- Monitor system health and troubleshoot production issues
- Improve deployment automation and reliability
- Ensure security best practices and compliance
- Mentor junior DevOps engineers

Qualifications:
- 5+ years in DevOps, SRE, or Infrastructure Engineering
- Strong understanding of cloud architecture and best practices
- Experience with production Kubernetes clusters at scale
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

Location: Remote (US)
Salary: $140K - $180K
testCases.resumeContent:
Marcus Thompson
Senior DevOps Engineer
marcus.thompson@email.com | Austin, TX | (555) 987-6543
LinkedIn: linkedin.com/in/marcusthompson

PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY
Senior DevOps Engineer with 7+ years of experience building and managing cloud infrastructure at scale. Deep expertise in Kubernetes, AWS, and infrastructure automation. Track record of improving deployment velocity, system reliability, and operational efficiency.

CORE COMPETENCIES
Container Orchestration: Kubernetes, EKS, Docker, Helm, Kustomize
Cloud Platforms: AWS (EKS, EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, IAM, CloudWatch), GCP (GKE)
Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible
CI/CD: Jenkins, GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, ArgoCD, Flux
Monitoring & Logging: Prometheus, Grafana, ELK Stack, CloudWatch, Datadog
Scripting & Programming: Python, Bash, Go, YAML
Security: AWS IAM, Security Groups, Secrets Management (Vault, AWS Secrets Manager)
Operating Systems: Linux (Ubuntu, Amazon Linux, CentOS), MacOS

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE

Senior DevOps Engineer | CloudScale Technologies | Austin, TX | 2020 - Present
- Lead DevOps engineer managing Kubernetes infrastructure serving 5M+ daily active users
- Architected and deployed multi-region AWS EKS clusters with 200+ nodes across 15 microservices
- Implemented GitOps workflow using ArgoCD for automated deployments, reducing deployment time from 2 hours to 10 minutes
- Created comprehensive Terraform modules for AWS infrastructure, achieving 100% infrastructure-as-code coverage
- Built CI/CD pipelines with GitHub Actions automating build, test, and deploy for 50+ repositories
- Developed custom Helm charts and Kubernetes operators for application deployment
- Implemented cluster autoscaling (HPA and Cluster Autoscaler) reducing infrastructure costs by 35%
- Established monitoring stack with Prometheus and Grafana, creating 40+ dashboards and alerting rules
- Configured ELK Stack for centralized logging across all services
- Implemented security best practices: Pod Security Policies, Network Policies, RBAC, and AWS IAM roles for service accounts
- Mentored team of 3 junior DevOps engineers on Kubernetes and AWS best practices
- Technologies: Kubernetes, AWS EKS, Terraform, ArgoCD, Helm, Prometheus, Grafana, Python, Bash

DevOps Engineer | TechCorp Solutions | San Francisco, CA | 2018 - 2020
- Managed AWS infrastructure for SaaS application (EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFront)
- Migrated monolithic application to containerized microservices on Kubernetes
- Built Docker images and Kubernetes manifests for 12 microservices
- Created Jenkins pipelines for automated testing and deployment
- Automated infrastructure provisioning using Terraform and CloudFormation
- Implemented monitoring with CloudWatch and Datadog
- On-call rotation for production support and incident response
- Technologies: Kubernetes, Docker, AWS, Jenkins, Terraform, Python, MySQL

Systems Administrator | DataCenter Inc. | Dallas, TX | 2017 - 2018
- Managed Linux servers and network infrastructure
- Automated system administration tasks using Bash and Python scripts
- Deployed applications to AWS EC2 instances
- Configured monitoring and alerting for servers and applications
- Technologies: Linux, AWS EC2, Python, Bash, Nagios

EDUCATION
Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering
University of Texas at Austin | 2013 - 2017

CERTIFICATIONS
- Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) - 2021
- AWS Certified Solutions Architect - Professional - 2022
- AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional - 2020
- HashiCorp Certified: Terraform Associate - 2021

groundTruth.reasoning: Exceptional match with 7 years experience, expert Kubernetes/EKS skills, strong AWS and Terraform expertise, comprehensive monitoring/GitOps experience, and relevant certifications
expectedStrengths: Exceeds experience requirements (7 years vs 5 required)
Expert Kubernetes and AWS EKS administration at scale
Strong infrastructure as code with Terraform and comprehensive DevOps tooling
groundTruth.testFocus: Validates excellent match for specialized DevOps role with all core and preferred skills

testCases.name: Mobile Engineer iOS/Swift Strong Match
testCases.jobDescription:
Senior iOS Engineer - Swift & SwiftUI

Join our mobile team to build cutting-edge iOS applications for millions of users worldwide.

Required Skills:
- 4+ years of iOS development experience
- Expert Swift programming
- SwiftUI and UIKit frameworks
- RESTful API integration and networking
- Core Data or Realm for local storage
- Git version control
- App Store submission and release management

Preferred Skills:
- Combine framework for reactive programming
- MVVM or Clean Architecture patterns
- Unit testing with XCTest
- CI/CD for iOS (Fastlane, GitHub Actions)
- Performance optimization and profiling
- Push notifications (APNs)

Responsibilities:
- Develop and maintain iOS applications
- Implement new features with SwiftUI and UIKit
- Integrate backend APIs and handle data persistence
- Write clean, testable code following best practices
- Optimize app performance and memory usage
- Collaborate with designers, product managers, and backend engineers
- Participate in code reviews and technical discussions

Qualifications:
- 4+ years of professional iOS development
- Published apps on the App Store
- Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field
- Strong problem-solving and communication skills

Location: Los Angeles, CA or Remote
Work Authorization: Required
testCases.resumeContent:
Emily Park
iOS Engineer

groundTruth.reasoning: Strong iOS match with 5 years experience, expert Swift/SwiftUI/Combine skills, proven App Store success, MVVM architecture, testing, and CI/CD experience
expectedStrengths: Exceeds experience requirements (5 years vs 4 required)

groundTruth.reasoning: Good match overall but 1 year short on experience (4 vs 5 required). Strong Java/Spring Boot skills, PostgreSQL experience, OAuth 2.0, Docker knowledge. Missing some preferred skills like Kafka, Redis, Kubernetes.
expectedStrengths: Strong Java and Spring Boot technical skills
Good PostgreSQL database experience and RESTful API development
Solid microservices understanding with Docker containerization
expectedConcerns: Experience below requirement: 1 year less than 5 years required
Missing key technical skills: Kafka, Redis, Kubernetes
groundTruth.testFocus: Tests good match with minor experience gap that's within acceptable range (1 year < 5 year max gap)
